DOC.brief_summary: This study involve approximately 200 patient design evaluate efficacy safety intranasal ( IN ) morphine 7.5 mg 15 mg , intravenous morphine ( IV ) 7.5 mg , immediate release oral ( PO ) morphine 60 mg placebo patient acute postsurgical pain follow third molar extraction .
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Safety Intranasal Morphine Pain After Third Molar Extraction
DOC.detailed_description: Diagnosis Main Criteria Inclusion : Dental outpatient undergo removal 3 third molar ( 2 require mandibular must bony impacted third molar ) .
DOC.criteria: Male female 1840 year age Surgical extraction least three third molar ( two must mandibular must bony impacted third molar ) Moderate severe pain within 6 hour completion surgery Other oral surgical procedure session except removal supernumerary third molar Evidence nasal congestion , nasal polyp , mucosal lesion nostril , postnasal drip etiology clinically significant nasal pathology may affect absorption study medication assessment safety Chronic respiratory insufficiency treatment opioid analgesic contraindicate Allergy shellfish Additional Inclusion/Exclusion Criteria May Apply
